pullRequest.body:
This PR deprecates the style of `tfae_have` syntax that behaves like Mathlib `have`, where the asserted hypothesis is prepended to the front of the goal list, in favor of `tfae_have ... := ...` syntax. It does so by preserving the old syntax and implementation in the same imports and logging a deprecation-styled warning. This warning can be turned off with `set_option Mathlib.Tactic.TFAE.useDeprecated true`.

This PR also includes some minor tweaks to `tfae_have` documentation and hover behavior to solidify `tfae_have ... := ...` as the current syntax.

It also modifies some old-style syntax that had crept into Mathlib in between the syntax removal (#11000) and this PR.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #11000

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
We didn't ever deprecated old-style mathlib `have`s (and in fact, sometimes they're still needed to work with `HasDerivAt`); so I'd actually argue that we also shouldn't deprecate this syntax.

@eric-wieser Hmm, that presents a few options. Let's continue the discussion [on zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/tfae_have.201.20.E2.86.92.202.20.3A.3D.20syntax/near/472324532)!

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11000~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> We didn't ever deprecated old-style mathlib `have`s (and in fact, sometimes they're still needed to work with `HasDerivAt`); so I'd actually argue that we also shouldn't deprecate this syntax.

Since old-style `tfae_have` syntax is beginning to creep back in, I removed the `awaiting-zulip` tag (after waiting a day for objections to merging this as-is).

To reiterate the justification for merging as-is that I gave on zulip here on the PR: I think providing the ability to use a `set_option` to turn off the deprecation warning provides enough of an escape hatch (equivalent to sequestering old-style `have` in its own import) if it's ever truly necessary to use the old-style syntax.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11628210453/job/32382943244)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11628210453/job/32382943043)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: deprecate "goal-style" `tfae_have` syntax
